item.title: Continuing with Hugo
item.description: I’m making progress with Hugo and restarting back with it to learn about Hugo and Git. It’s very fun to start trying to learn code. item.title: A poem for Maths Teacher
item.description: You brought numbers into our lives Alphabets you knew 6 and how I wish they weren’t algebraic Logs were tricky and decimals weren’t fun but solved complex equations only for U Problems you had infinite from the book or life With solutions you nurtured logic and common sense Trigonometry was monotony until you came up with geometry. Oh! And I Never knew shapes would be this important Until I met the gym coach He’s a constant remainder for size zero.

item.title: Second Day
item.description: Second day fiddling via the CLI and git and hugo. And here is a list of things that I have done. Tweaked my Zshrc config file with a bunch of UI hacks. Upgraded my command line tools to Big sur’s versions, it was outdated, surprising that I was running CLI tools from Mojave if I am not wrong. A first time ever 60 tabs on the current Firefox window, mostly due to debuggings.
